intro: Closirospermum asperum, commonly known as the rough bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Leguminosae family, characterized by its pod-like fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant has hairy, erect stems and small, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Its flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, arranged in clusters, and it produces inflated, leathery pods that contain several seeds. This species is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient component of desert ecosystems.
